definitions.definition: The process of becoming rotten; putrefaction.
Any of several diseases in which breakdown of tissue occurs.
To suffer decomposition due to biological action, especially by fungi or bacteria.
definitions.example: The apple left in the cupboard all that time had started to rot.

definitions.definition: To decline in function or utility.
definitions.example: Your brain will rot if you spend so much time on the computer, Tony!

definitions.definition: To (cause to) deteriorate in any way, as in morals; to corrupt.
To make putrid; to cause to be wholly or partially decomposed by natural processes.
To spend a long period of time (in an unpleasant place).
To expose, as flax, to a process of maceration, etc., for the purpose of separating the fiber; to ret.
